arm_group.description: IV administration. 100 mg/kg for one hour followed by 30 mg/kg/hour for five hours
IV administration.  300 mg/kg for one hour followed by 200 mg/kg/hr for five hours

brief_summary.textblock:
This study has been designed in compliance with the ICH-E14 guideline (2005) to evaluate the
      effect of ANX-188 at therapeutic and supratherapeutic concentrations on cardiac
      repolarization, specifically, Fridericia's QT-Interval (QTcF)

clinical_study.brief_title: ANX-188 Thorough QT/QTc Study in Healthy Volunteers

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Healthy male and female subjects aged 18 to 65 (inclusive) in good health as
             determined by past medical history, physical examination, vital signs,
             electrocardiogram, and laboratory testing at screening.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Participation in a clinical trial within the last 60 days

          -  Pregnant or lactating females

          -  Use of prescription drugs, herbals, or over-the-counter medications within 14 days
             prior to study day -2

          -  Uncontrolled cardiac arrhythmias, cardiac valve abnormalities, or not in normal sinus
             rhythm

          -  Smokers or tobacco product user in the prior 3 months

          -  Presence of clinically significant illness

          -  Other protocol defined inclusion/exclusion criteria may apply

clinical_study.official_title: A Four Period, Four-Arm, Crossover Design, Randomized, Placebo and Active Controlled Study for the Evaluation of the Effect of Therapeutic and Supratherapeutic Single-Dose ANX-188 on the QT/QTc Intervals in Healthy Volunteers

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the effect of therapeutic and supratherapeutic doses of ANX-188 on cardiac ventricular repolarization, specifically, the Fridericia's corrected QT-Interval (QTcF)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Heart rate measurements on treatment compared to time-matched baseline and placebo
RR-interval on treatment compared to time-matched baseline and placebo
QRS measurements on treatment compared to time-matched baseline and placebo
PR interval measurements on treatment compared to time-matched baseline and placebo
Overall characterization of normal and abnormal ECGs and the number and percentage of subjects with normal and abnormal ECGs
Number and percentage of subjects that develop abnormalities of repolarization on treatment
Number and percentage of subjects the develop abnormal U waves
Relationship between changes from the baseline and placebo in QTcF (DDQTcF)
Correlation of ECG findings with clinical adverse events

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety Study, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Basic Science
